segments.text: What seems to be the problem ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your secretary seems to think she is being harassed .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ? You've got to be kidding me !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I wish I were , but i am deadly serious . She said you invited her to dinner last week .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Of course I did . As recognition for a job well done . Once a month I invite the most productive employee to dinner .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , there is no problem there . But she seemed to think that you were angry when she refused , and that your motives are personal and not professional .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think she's misinterpreted my intentions . What happens now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Our harassment policy requires that we have a meeting with the HR manager and Miss Brown . It's quite serious . You could be reprimanded , or even fired if we find evidence that you were pressuring
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I understand that . But I hope that we can get to the bottom fo this and show Miss Brown that she misunderstood my reaction .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's the purpose of the meeting . Sometimes a mediated conversation will straighten things out , and a little discussion and apology can calm the waters .
segments.speaker: S2
